title: It’s a pirates life for Dawson’s Creek star James Van Der Beek and family
text:
It’s a pirates life for the Van Der Beek family (Picture: Instagram)

Dawson’s Creek star James Van Der Beek got the whole family involved in Dancing With The Stars’ Disney takeover, taking his five children to Disneyland for a fun day trip.

‘Is this how you’re supposed to look fearsome? #DisneyNight tonight on #dwts 8/7c on ABC,’ he captioned the snap which showed Olivia, nine, Joshua, seven, Annabel, five, and Emilia, three brandishing large swords while Joshua also modeled a hook on his hand.

Youngest daughter Gwendolyn, 16 months, was wisely kept away from the swords – or maybe she was playing the part of a Lost Boy.

But their trip came as James performed a Paso Doble for the judges to He’s A Pirate by Klaus Badelt, from the movie Pirates Of The Caribbean: The Curse Of The Black PearL.

Ahoy me hearties! (Picture: Instagram)

‘If I didn’t love this dance, it would have been impossible. Impossible to learn, to practice or to perform at this level of intensity. It was challenging physically, mentally, even emotionally,’ he later shared after his performance.

‘But the choreography by the incredible @theemmaslater gave me so much to commit to as an actor… and we worked hard. Really hard.

‘And it was worth it. Most fun I’ve had on this show to date. And that’s saying something. Still buzzing. I will be for some time.’

James and his wife Kimberley revealed on last week’s episode of the hit dancing show that they are expecting their sixth child, after several devastating miscarriages.

Speaking to People magazine after his performance on Monday, he admitted that ‘Kimberly decided to do it on camera, to open it up and allow people to go through the experience — good result or not good result’.

James and his wife Kimberley revealed on last week’s episode of the hit dancing show that they are expecting their sixth child (Picture: Instagram)

‘The only advice I have is that you can’t reason your way out of it and you can’t talk your way out of it,’ he said, speaking to others who may be going through the same as him and Kimberley.

‘You just have to let yourself go through it and go through the journey and be there for each other,’ he concluded.

‘Know that you can’t judge the pain, you can’t judge the process. For us, thankfully, we also have three rainbow babies. It’s life. And also, don’t be afraid to talk about [it].

‘There’s a weird stigma that might still exist around it … things like that is when you need your family and friends.’

description: James Van Der Beek performed a Pirates Of The Carribean dance on Dancing With The Stars.
